title: Dior’s British designer Kim Jones awarded knighthood in Paris
description: Artistic director collects award at Paris fashion week while rumour mill suggests Gucci, Burberry or Margiela moveFriday afternoon in Paris was a big one for the British designer Kim Jones. The artistic director not only presented his latest menswear collection for Dior, he also collected the prestigious Chevalier de la Légion d’honneur, a rarity for someone from outside France. In a fashion moment par excellence, the award was presented to him by Anna Wintour, becoming a knight in the process.Jones has been at Dior for six years, designing the brand’s menswear collections. During that time, he has explored the brand’s rich archive and also personal interests, including TS Eliot’s The Waste Land and Vanessa Bell’s house Charleston in east Sussex. This show was no different. It took Christian Dior’s mid-50s Ligne H collection as its jump-off, but made Casanova – the 18th-century Italian author known for his multiple relationships with women – its muse. Continue reading...
author: Lauren Cochrane

title: The rule of thirds: a beginner’s guide to transforming your look | Jess Cartner-Morley on fashion
description: Three really is the magic number if you want to enhance your silhouetteDo you know about the rule of thirds? I didn’t. How did I not know about it? Anyway, I do now and I am obsessed. And you will be, too. So listen up.The rule of thirds is a simple trick that makes you look better, by tweaking your proportions. It is failsafe, it is free, it works on everybody. If you are average height, it makes you look taller. I always wanted to be taller. In fact, in my heart, I believe that I am 5ft 10, like Cindy Crawford, although on the outside I am only 5ft 5½. I’ve never got to the bottom of this mystifying mix-up, but the rule of thirds is a more effective solution than high heels. And it doesn’t just make you look taller, it makes you look better. If you are already tall it makes you look leggier, and whatever height you are it enhances your silhouette, giving you a more supple, fluid line. Continue reading...
author: Jess Cartner-Morley

title: Feel Like A White Lotus Guest In This Abercrombie & Fitch Collab
description: .disclaimer{width:90%;margin-bottom:1rem}.disclaimer__lines{width:100%;margin:0 auto;border-bottom:1px solid #999;padding:0;max-width:150px}.disclaimer__copy{width:100%;max-width:355px;font-family:Brown Regular,sans-serif;font-size:.9rem;font-weight:300;line-height:1.3em;color:#333;padding:0 0 .4rem;margin:1rem auto;text-align:center} All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission. Get excited, because it’s nearly time to check into The White Lotus hotel… well, kind of. The much-anticipated third season of HBO’s The White Lotus — starring Parker Posey, Walton Goggins, and more — premieres on February 16. Ahead of the launch, several fashion brands are releasing collaborations inspired by the fictional resort which is set in Thailand this season. This week, Abercrombie & Fitch joined the list with a loungey, resort-inspired capsule.  The limited-edition unisex collection features graphic crewnecks, relaxed T-shirts, textured short-sleeve button-ups, and a baseball cap. While some styles feature a cheeky “do not disturb” plea, others nod to the show’s newest locale. “Our customers love to travel and live for the luxury of a long weekend,” Abercrombie chief marketing officer, Carey Collins Krug, said in a press statement. “We loved the idea of combining our customer’s favorite styles with graphics inspired by the iconic and beachside luxury of The White Lotus.”  Alongside the collaboration, Abercrombie also released its new linen-cotton blend Breezy Shirts and Baggy Breezy Pull-On Pants to pair with the limited-edition styles and to round out your vacationwear. Whether you’re actually traveling to a luxe seaside getaway, or are planning to lounge luxuriously on your couch while watching the series, these styles deserve a spot in your weekender bag (or dresser drawer). All you have to do is click “add to bag” and wait for your dose of dopamine to arrive in the mail. Shop full Abercrombie & Fitch x The White Lotus capsule collection Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?Anthropologie New Brand Celandine Has Plus SizesOur Favorite Looks From Free People's Spring DropVacation-Ready Looks Inspired By The White Lotus
author: Victoria Montalti

title: The Freshest Spring Trends You Can Shop At Free People
description: .disclaimer{width:90%;margin-bottom:1rem}.disclaimer__lines{width:100%;margin:0 auto;border-bottom:1px solid #999;padding:0;max-width:150px}.disclaimer__copy{width:100%;max-width:355px;font-family:Brown Regular,sans-serif;font-size:.9rem;font-weight:300;line-height:1.3em;color:#333;padding:0 0 .4rem;margin:1rem auto;text-align:center} All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission. Spring may be months away, but that doesn’t mean we can’t start curating our warm-weather wardrobe — especially now that Free People dropped its latest campaign, which is a feminine, boho daydream come to life. This new collection offers a fresh, modern take on the retailer’s signature look, featuring lace-trimmed and floral-print tees paired with utilitarian staples like barn jackets (still a thing!) and cargo-pocketed carpenter shorts. There’s also a prep-school charm woven in via cardigans and polos, styled with loafers and knee-high socks, as well as perfectly slouchy denim and ’90s-inspired baby tees. Then, of course, there are vacation-ready pieces with an artisanal feel for those spring break escapes to somewhere sun-soaked.With standout looks from in-house labels like We The Free and free-est, Free People’s spring collection nails every vibe worth pinning to your mood board. Take a closer look at the campaign and shop the six key trends for the season ahead. DashDividers_1_500x100 Casual Romance  Sweet but not overly saccharine, these romantic styles are all about balancing feminine details with everyday ease. The lace-trimmed tanks and embroidered tees in so-soft fabrics are essentials for laid-back spring days. Prep Classics Prep-school polish gets a Free People twist — think cardigans and polos with more exaggerated fits and distinctive details (hello, eyelet collar), styled back to loafers and knee-high socks. It’s a nod to timeless collegiate charm, only with a fresh edge. Big, Bold Denim  The whispers of a skinny jeans resurgence won’t have us parting with baggy jeans just yet. Slouchy, oversized silhouettes still have our hearts, whether paired with baby tees or bikini tops. Utility From cargo-pocketed vests to barn jackets that add structure to breezy spring ‘fits, these staples blend practicality with low-key cool — perfect for grounding those floral-print, lace-trimmed tops. Vacation Ready These pieces are made for your next passport stamp. Featuring global-inspired prints and embroideries with an artisanal feel, these will be your spring break go-tos. Just add sun, SPF, and a woven tote. ‘90s Minimalism  Channel your inner Gwyneth or Jen with ’90s-inspired staples like baby tees and lace-trimmed slip skirts. These pared-back pieces are the ultimate blank slate for creative spring styling. Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?24 Free People Gifts That Are Utterly DashingWhy This Free People Dress Is A Compliment-Magnet10 NYFW Spring 2024 Trends To Shop Right Now
author: Karina Hoshikawa

title: 26 Top Picks From Abercrombie, Including “The White Lotus” Collection
description: Who would have thought that our closets would be filled with Abercrombie & Fitch again?! Abercrombie has long been famous for its expansive collection of flattering jeans, which are editor-loved. But recently, the retailer went through a little makeover of its own; long gone are the days of logo-filled graphic T-shirts and limited denim offerings, now the brand is a haven for all types of fashion-lovers - and sizes. It's the best place to shop for everything from stylish, elevated basics to vintage-inspired looks, seasonal trends, and even wedding guest dresses. Into football? You can shop the Abercrombie's official NFL collection ahead of the Super Bowl and sport your favorite team. If you're a fan of HBO Max's "The White Lotus," you can also shop the brand's limited edition collection inspired by the show. It's filled with vacation-ready breezy pieces, including textured button down sets and sweatshirts. They also have collaborations with several Formula 1 teams, if you're into fast cars. The brand is clearly back and better than ever, and if TikTok hasn't already convinced you to shop at Abercrombie, let us do that for you. From trendy tops and elevated dresses to comfortable, tailored bottoms, Abercrombie has become synonymous with effortlessly chic clothing. The brand carries everything you need for a fashion-forward closet. From classic denim to its flattering silhouettes and expanded size range, Abercrombie has something for everyone. Plus, if something doesn't fit quite right, or the color you've been eyeing is finally back in stock, the brand makes it convenient to file a return or exchange. Abercrombie & Fitch's Return Policy Abercrombie & Fitch has a return policy of 30 days from the date of the last shipment, as long as you have your receipt, invoice, or order confirmation. Returns received after the 30-day mark will be refunded in an e-gift card for merchandise credit. If you love a style but just need a different size or color, you can exchange it in store or online through this return portal. Active Abercrombie & Fitch Promo Codes and Sales Right now, you can get 25 percent off nearly sitewide for a limited time. You can also get up to 50 percent off clearance. Plus, you can get free shipping when you spend $99 or more. We love browsing the site for the brand's newest arrivals and even scoring a deal or two on a few pieces. So we decided to make your life easier and rounded up our current favorite wardrobe essentials and dresses from Abercrombie, both new and on sale, so you know what's worth buying - especially for the winter. Keep reading to shop our top picks from Abercrombie & Fitch, or jump ahead to the category you're looking for. Shop Abercrombie & Fitch's "The White Lotus" Collection Shop Editor-Favorite Picks From Abercrombie & Fitch Shop Abercrombie & Fitch Dresses Shop Abercrombie & Fitch New Clothing
author: Anvita Reddy

title: 3 Editors Test Drive Quince's Affordable Leather Jackets
description: When it comes to fashion, whether you're minimalist, maximalist, or something entirely in between, there's one staple item you need in your wardrobe: a leather jacket. It's truly the Swiss army knife of clothing. There are plenty of different styles to choose from, including oversize, cropped, and motorcycle - just to name a few. You can dress it up or down, and whether you're wearing it for a date or throwing it on for a quick grocery store run, there's nothing like a well-worn leather jacket that is perfectly you. However, finding a high-quality leather jacket at a price that won't break the bank is no easy feat. Luckily, we think we found a brand that checks all of our boxes and has something for everyone, no matter what style you're seeking. Allow us to introduce you to Quince. Quince is all about offering high-quality items made with premium materials at an affordable price. How do they do it? The direct-to-consumer brand uses a factory-direct model and keeps costs low by cutting out the supply-chain middlemen. They make home and travel products, but right now, our editors couldn't be more obsessed with their leather jackets. Ahead, three editors put three different styles of Quince's 100-percent leather jackets to the test. You can check us out modeling different options, read about how they worked for us, and then use our tips to help you make your own purchase - we promise you won't regret it. Keep scrolling to read our honest thoughts.
author: Renee Rodriguez
